titlepage.titleproper: Register of the Austrian Subject Collection, 1893-1996
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 1997 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Austrian Subject Collection,

physdesc.label: Extent
physdesc.extent: 6 manuscript boxes, 1 oversize box, 1 videotape cassette

did.abstract: Pamphlets, leaflets, clippings, serial issues, and other printed matter, relating to various aspects of twentieth-century Austrian history and politics, including the socialist revolt of 1934, the Anschluss of 1938, the anti-Nazi movement in Austria, post-World War II student radicalism at the Universitat Wien, the Austrian movement for European unity, and elections in Austria.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Austrian subject collection, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog Socrates at http://library.stanford.edu/webcat. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in Socrates is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

did.unittitle: SUBJECT FILE, 1867-1994.

scopecontent.p: Leaflets, reports, programs, election and government literature relating to Austrian history and political life, arranged chronologically and then by subject

did.unittitle: OVERSIZE MATERIAL, 1925.

scopecontent.p: Financial reports and statements for fiscal year 1925 for the province of Kdrnten

did.unittitle: SUBJECT FILE, 1867-1994

Miscellany. Bulletins, newsletters, and serial issues, l935-l954, issued by Austrian fascists before the Anschluss, and by anti-fascist Austrian emigres in Great Britain (Young Austria - Junges Oesterreich, Zeitspiegel- Weekly Review) and in France during World War II. Includes a certificate awarded to the New York Public Library by the Austrian Council for South Africa, l947, and typewritten compilation of information about the Austrian General Franz Conrad von Hoetzendorf, prepared by Dimitri Birkin, l954. In German and English
1867-1918. Pamphlets, newspaper and serial issues, reports, and resolutions, 1893-1914, issued by various socialist and workers' parties and associations. In German
Anschluss, March 1938. Postage stamp issued in 1988 recalling the Anschluss of March 11
Dollfuss, Engelbert. Leaflet, l934, issued in commemoration of Engelbert Dollfuss, Chancellor of Austria, following his assassination during the Nazi Putsch of July 1934. In German
Plebiscite, April 1938
Ballot used in the April 10 plebiscite on the union with Germany. In German
Pamphlet by E. Muller-Sturmheim entitled 99.7%: APlebiscite Under Nazi Rule, 1942
Socialist and communist opposition
General. Pamphlets published by the socialist and communist parties in the l930s, relating to their programs and to the anti-Nazi movement in Austria. In German
Revolt, February 1934
General. Broadsides, leaflets, and mimeographed articles primarily relating to the revolt of the social-democrats on February 12. In German

Schutzbund. Clippings from Austrian newspapers, l935, relating to the trial of leaders of the Schutzbund, the armed defense organization of the social democratic party, after the events of 1934. In German. Includes several issues of Kleines Volks-Zeitung, 1935
Underground literature. Socialist and communist underground leaflets, with camouflage covers, ca. l935-l936. In German
Report of the United States Commissioner on the Military Government of Austria, November 1945
Issue of London-Information of the Austrian Socialistsin Great Britain, 15 April 1946. In English
Miscellany. Page from a newspaper issue, 1957, giving the words and music of the song "Lied der Arbeit." In German
Elections, 1988-1989. Election campaign literature and leaflets related to Austrian politics. In German
European Federation - Referendum, 1994. Pamphlets, serial issues, declarations, press releases, and position statements. In German and English
Freiheitliche Partei Oesterreichs. Party platform
Government publications (Chancellor's office)
General
Economy and banking
Education
Environment
Foreign policy
Social policy
Maastricht treaty, February 7, 1992. In German
Kreisky, Bruno. Flyer issued by the Sozialistischer Jugendrat announcing a meeting with Bruno Kreisky to celebrate Austrian minorities, 18 March 1988. In German
Left wing movement. Brochures, circulars, flyers, magazine and newspaper issues, and stickers, 1992. Includes material from May 1 celebration. In German

Student organizations. Leaflets, periodicals, handwritten posters, and other miscellaneous materials, l970-l97l, distributed at the University of Vienna and relating primarily to the Osterreichische Studentenunion (Austrian Student Union) and university reform. In German
Waldheim, Kurt. Flyer and sticker relating to an anti-Waldheim demonstration held in February 1988. In German
OVERSIZE MATERIAL.
Financial reports and statements for fiscal year 1925 for the province of Karnten
INCREMENTAL MATERIALS

scopecontent.p: This addition to the collection has not yet been described. Please let the Hoover Institution Archives know if you would like to see this material described.
